snippet: Officials in Washington and traders on Wall Street are looking to Nov. 1, when more than $55 billion in federal payments come due.
abstract: Officials in Washington and traders on Wall Street are not only looking at Oct 17, the day the Treasury Dept expects to exhaust its so-called extraordinary measures to keep paying the country's bills, but also Nov 1, when more than $55 billion in federal payments come due; time period leading up to Nov 1, should Congress fail to raise the debt ceiling, will most likely be one of market turbulence, plummeting confidence and a slowing economy.
lead_paragraph: Officials in Washington and traders on Wall Street are looking to Nov. 1, when more than $55 billion in federal payments come due.

headline.main: Tracing the Calendar Down to the Last Cent
headline.print_headline: Tracing the Calendar Down to the Last Cent
